noun.description: Any of various fishes constituting the tropical family Polynemidae, having pectoral fins divided into two parts, the lower of which consists of several long rays; a threadfin.

adjective.description: Of or relating to fishes of the family Polynemidae.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Isaac Funk (1839–1912), publisher and reformer. From scientific Latin Polynemus, genus name + -id, after scientific Latin Polynemidae, family name.
